job description:
We are currently seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented Data Analyst (Scorecarding) to join our team in Washington, DC to begin an exciting and challenging career with Unisys Federal Systems.

The Data Analyst (Scorecarding) will develop two types of cybersecurity health reports/scorecards.

In this role you will:
  • Collaborate with government employees to define the requirements.
  • Extract data from various databases and systems in order to generate an automated scorecard system, or provide recommendation(s) for Commercial off the Shelf Tools (COTS) tools for the government to procure.
  • Assist with implementation of the Commercial off the Shelf Tools (COTS) tools.
  • Create scorecards that are visually appealing, functional, and based on industry best practices. Develop a process and standard for source documents should the summary scorecard require more in depth evaluation. Requirements
  • At least four years of experience analyzing technical, programmatic, and/or administrative data.
  • Experience with and knowledge of statistical analysis for large data sets.
  • Experience with and knowledge of various data visualization methods and techniques, including selection of the most meaningful display for particular analyses.
  • Demonstrated experience using MS Excel in statistical application, including lookups and pivot tables.
  • Microsoft Office proficiency is required.
  • An understanding of or familiarity with IT/cybersecurity is preferred.
  • A bachelor's degree in a related discipline and 10 years experience or equivalent
